> [{quoted}](name=RiotRepertoir,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=tm52eJ4z,comment-id=0017,timestamp=2015-08-09T23:43:05.497+0000)

> 
> I'd be happy to talk about whichever it is that you're interested in, though.

The community was promised that Garens silence wouldn't be touched. In any form or way. I really did trust that to stick, but having one second chunked off of it? He has no CC other than that silence. It's his only reliable way currently after the upcoming 'rework' that will allow him to stick to an enemy champion. It doesn't make any sense for his silence to get nuked like this. It's hard to hold trust in a company I love when they can't keep a small promise like that.

Even though comparing Garen's silence to Chogaths doesn't really make complete sense, why is it that Chogath gets a knockup, a severely strong slow, a AoE 2.5 second silence, along with a guaranteed, a instantaneous true-damage ultimate with a 70% AP scaling that also grows in range, along with a stacking health benefit? Doesn't that just SCREAM overloaded? while Garen..he gets a 1.5 second silence in his entire kit, and is forced to be only useful against a SOLE target due to the new 'villain' mechanic. 

Garen deserves, needs, and SHOULD, keep his 2.5 second silence. Keep its scaling, that at least keeps it beneficially fair -- and don't argue that it isn't fair. He doesn't have nearly as much CC as any other champion out there. He relies on that for his safety and stick. This is especially the case with E making him SLOWER if he ticks an enemy with a hit. It's literally going to make him too immobile to stick to any champion. I can't believe that the reasoning behind Garens silence getting nerfed is 'to get his full combo off'. 

ANYONE, can get their full combo off, if they're able to catch an opponent off guard. Hello? Where do you think the Garen in a Bush joke came from? His stick when catching an opponent off-guard is 100% deserved. If you get outplayed and walk into a trap or awaiting enemy champion, you DESERVE, to get  full-combo'd, resulting in your death. 

Seriously. Rethink your method here, Repertoir. You've always been reliable in your position -- I know, i've followed and loved the work you've done. But I know well enough that YOU know, tearing the silence from his kit when everyone was promised it would stay (BECAUSE it's his ONLY CC) is a stupid, and rash decision.

 If you look at Garen in comparison to Cho, like others have mentioned here..How exactly is it fair that Cho gets 3 CC capabilities, one of them being a hard CC at that, and a true-damage nuke with SCALING? And a health-raising benefit? While Garen gets a fixed damage execute which is worthless unless the enemy is below 30% health. 

While we're at it. Could we talk about the revert on Garens W? I thought this was addressed simply under the reasoning of 'scaling/stacking benefits are toxic'? What was wrong with Garen's W as it currently is? You're making him squishier and more worthless -- Taking his W destroys his late-game durability scaling. This didn't need to change either. No offense..But Garen was 100% healthy, and fine as-is. All he needed were QoL changes, or late-game buffs...Not complete and utter gutting.

> The community was promised that Garens silence wouldn't be touched. In any form or way.

From what I understand, any messaging about Garen's update said his Silence would still be there, not necessarily that it would go untouched in any way, shape, or form. Can you show me where we said that? Because that seems like a big goof up on our end if that's the case. So, on that topic, yeah, no one should have promised that :(

> If you look at Garen in comparison to Cho, like others have mentioned here..How exactly is it fair that Cho gets 3 CC capabilities, one of them being a hard CC at that, and a true-damage nuke with SCALING? And a health-raising benefit? While Garen gets a fixed damage execute which is worthless unless the enemy is below 30% health.

Though historically we haven't made many efforts to differentiate between tanks like Cho'Gath and tanky guys like Garen, we're trying to establish that differentiation to some extent. Though we haven't really investigated Cho'Gath directly yet, he falls much more toward the general idea of what a tank is. Durable, heavy crowd control, and low sustained damage (though his sustained damage may be too high for this to be true). Garen, on the other hand, is being pushed toward a much higher sustained damage pattern than he's ever had in the past, to the point that we're classifying him as a carry. I think we can probably agree that carries shouldn't have a high level of crowd control, though it doesn't necessarily follow that a 2.5 second silence is a 'high level of crowd control.' Maybe Cho does too much damage for a tank or is unfair in some other way (like his silence duration), but it's probably not the best idea to reduce Cho's silence duration because we're reducing Garen's, and it's also probably not the best idea to think we have to leave Garen's silence alone because there are other characters whose silences are longer.

I will say this about the duration reduction on Garen's silence. I lowered it to a duration that felt fair given the higher damage the character will now do. Is 1.5 seconds too low? Possibly, but it definitely wasn't reduced because Riot doesn't like silence. With his upcoming changes, we're trying to put him in a spot where he can be seen as a real threat, and less of a guy whose usefulness falls off dramatically as the game goes on. If we're not hitting that mark after his release, I'll try to calibrate upward.

> While we're at it. Could we talk about the revert on Garens W? I thought this was addressed simply under the reasoning of 'scaling/stacking benefits are toxic'? What was wrong with Garen's W as it currently is? You're making him squishier and more worthless -- Taking his W destroys his late-game durability scaling. This didn't need to change either. No offense..But Garen was 100% healthy, and fine as-is. All he needed were QoL changes, or late-game buffs...Not complete and utter gutting.

This update aims to increase Garen's affinity for Health items, and flat resistances are a good way to do that. Maybe this just reads as a nerf or something, but in almost all cases, it's just not. I sure don't think 'scaling/stacking benefits are toxic,' and if that was formerly our stance, we have changed a lot in the past few years, and the game has too. Overall, he should not be squishier, except in the case of full tank builds. As to 'complete and utter gutting,' that seems to imply the character is going to fall to a sub 45% win rate or something. With the changes going in, I'd be truly surprised if it was closer to 45% than 55%. I could be wrong here, but we're _definitely_ not aiming for a gutting, or even a nerf at all. If he comes out and proves to be weak, I'll be happy to admit we missed the mark on him, and buff him up a bit, probably in places where we took some stuff away.
I wish you were in charge of the Morde rework like omfg how much more open and nice can you be? ;-;

the main thing here is: isn´t the main focus on your juggernaut rework that they should be really rewarded for closing the gap? so what´s wrong with Garen unleashing his full combo within the silence once he got close? Closing in on Vayne just to get shoved aside again before you can even think about ulting her down won´t surly ever make Garen viable...

They should indeed be rewarded for getting on top of a target, and in most cases following the update, I'd expect a late game Garen to easily kill a late game Vayne in a 1.5 second silence _if_ he manages to close the gap and get a silence off on her.

regardless of what has been said here I would like to say that with the reverting of the nerfs to the E slow and the passive nerf Garen looks like he can finally succeed at his job again. Nerfing the aoe damage of the spin and trading that out for the new ult passive and E damage increase is fair. As someone who mains garen I can say that even with the silence nerfed, letting us be able to close the gap again without kiting outselves with E is all we really wanted. Sure we will take a hit to base stats, the silence and aoe damage. But the amount we get in trade for the ultimate passive and the increased ticks of judgement is more than fair and I appreciate you guys for listening to our feedback here. 

Silencing for 3 seconds isn't a core part of Garen's identity, no one thinks of garen and goes "that guy who can silence you". No, they think a spinning death blade who will drop a sword on your head. With that said: Garen DOES need some form of CC, and with that in mind I am glad you guys are letting us keep the silence, albeit in a weakened state.
killing anyone in 1.5 secs is assassin tier damage. a tanky champ like garen that can soak damage from everyone and still being able to assassinate any squishy in 1.5 secs is ludicrous.

Not when the person you're killing is a squishy that you silenced and you had to somehow surprise or have your teammates cc long enough to get into melee range of them. Also he's probably not going to build quite as tanky post update in order to achieve that damage, which will mean he's maybe not so able to soak damage from everyone.

I just played a game where I had a randuins and sunfire as nunu, and the enemy garen was still shredding me with just a black cleaver for damage. (rest of his items were tank stuff like randuins, sunfire, spirit visage etc)

If garen can do that now, he won't need to build dmg when this rework comes thru.

"If garen can do that now, he won't need to build dmg when this rework comes thru."

The thing is he won't be as tanky regardless of what he builds. This will incentivize people to build more damage on him I think. Ideally his numbers will be balanced with that in mind. I'm not 100% up to date on all the latest details of his changes though and we gotta remember the new juggernaut items coming out as well.

More importantly though is that killing anyone in 1.5 seconds isn't actually the hallmark of an assassin in league (nor actually how long it'll take Garen to kill people :p ). It's just how fast squishies die to anyone that does good damage really. ADCs and mages often kill each other that fast in the late game.

League sadly seems to consider champions assassins if they can do that kind of damage AND get in and out of fights easily. Because nothing says 'high risk, high reward' like taking out all of the risk and none of the reward, right Riot....? -_-

I guess the problem people are having is that you are taking away part of his ability to be a tank (with lots of disruption) by removing his long duration CC, his Tenacity that allows him to more easily charge into a team, and lowering his damage to an entire group.

As it stands, with his high single target burst damage and his true damage to the Villain, it feels like you're moving Garen towards being a tanky assassin whose main job is to run at the Villain, silence him, smash with E a bit and then execute (and then die).

I guess I'm confused because I'm 90% sure Meddler said that tanky assassins were bad for the game, and that's why Diana is so hard to balance (and why Riot had to nerf Tank Ekko). 

You want this guy to be a juggernaut, with lots of sustained damage, but his damage is so much higher when he's against a single target that it seems more likely that this guy will end up being played as an assassin. Perhaps if you returned some of his team fighting power so that he could be more disruptive or deal more damage to multiple units like Darius and Mordekaiser...but if that's missing the mark on your rework then I don't know what to say other than "Riot took a stance against tanky assassins and your rework seems to be going against that".

> You want this guy to be a juggernaut, with lots of sustained damage, but his damage is so much higher when he's against a single target that it seems more likely that this guy will end up being played as an assassin.

Though he will now do a lot of damage to a target, Garen lacks the mobility profile and target selection of a real assassin. Assassins get to blink or dash to where they want to be, try to kill a guy, and then get out, and they often have the tools to do all that. Garen has to run at a guy, stick to them for 3 seconds, and then run away. As such, I don't really see him as an assassin.

Okay, that's fair. The question then becomes: What IS your vision for Garen here?

You want the juggernauts to be unique. Makes sense. So, Garen is supposed to be a tanky damage dealer with poor initiation, low crowd control, who does a lot of single target damage to a fed enemy (but not as much as Mordekaiser) and a little bit of damage to the rest of the enemy team (but not as much as Darius).

Don't get me wrong, the Villain mechanic is cool and I bet it's going to be really useful, but I don't feel like the reward for a juggernaut managing to get to his target should be large single-target damage. 

If it works consistently, then Garen is a tanky assassin, pure and simple. If he is able to reliably reach his target and execute them, then he is a more toxic, more team reliant Diana, and the counterplay to his kit relies on interactions with his teammates, not with him. 

If it does not work consistently, then Garen's reward for reaching the enemy team with the help of his teammates is maybe killing the Villain and dealing some AOE damage to the rest of the enemy team with his E. If they don't CC him, or shield it, or just move out of the way. 

You want Garen to have a stronger boost for actually reaching the enemy team. He's less sticky but he's more greatly rewarded for sticking. But only against one person. 

It just seems counterintuitive. A juggernaut should be like a DPS version of a tank, where rather than crowd control, it's their massive potential to disrupt a team by raw AOE damage that should terrify the enemy and force them to be removed as a threat. 

But Garen's AOE ability is spread out over 3 seconds, easily kitable, short range, and deals less damage to multiple units.

I don't know, maybe I'm just not seeing the reward here. Please explain it to me. If this rework works out EXACTLY as you intend it to, what is the highlight of Garen's gameplay supposed to look like?

>  If this rework works out EXACTLY as you intend it to, what is the highlight of Garen's gameplay supposed to look like?

Garen does the baseline stuff of a Juggernaut (tanky, high damage, low mobility profile) with some additional assassin-like tendencies against a single, semi-random target.

When I think about what these Juggernauts are, they should all be really tanky, they should all deal high damage to the enemy team, and they should all be relatively immobile, _PLUS_ one or two additional differentiating aspects (Villainy, in Garen's case).

Maybe the "increased damage when hitting a single target" doesn't send a perfect message, but Garen's damage in teamfights should still be on par or higher than these other guys. I expect his aoe damage to still be really high despite that addition.
